issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: If nm start without recovery enabled, there may be many deprecated app log dir in NM log dirs, NM should clean up them.
fields.summary: NM should clean up app log dirs after NM restart

This message was automatically generated.
Thanks for the patch!  Looks good to me, kicking another Jenkins run to make sure it's still clean.

Does the current patch have the potential to leak {{application\_\*\_\*\_DEL\_\*}} directories? In {{ResourceLocalizationService#cleanupLogDir}} would we want to check if the renamed \_DEL\_ directory exists in the case where the original log directory doesn't exist and delete if necessary?

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |

This message was automatically generated.

I don't believe it will leak those directories.  The exists check is on the root log dir, not the app log dirs.  Since we rename the log dirs underneath the same root log dir, if that root dir doesn't exist then none of the DEL directories will either.
+1 for the latest patch.  I'll commit this tomorrow if there are no objections.

bq. The exists check is on the root log dir, not the app log dirs.
Ah. Gotcha. +1 from me as well.
